content:
ICS 1C HW 2 for QQ Skeleton -- Heading

About QQ Skeleton

Name:Yoko Hattori
E-mail: easu1258@rigel.oac.uci.edu
Major: Comparative Culture

Three neat Web finds:

  1. Mariah Carey is one of my favorite singers. She produced three albums and one Christmas alubum so far. Her voice is so powerful and soulful. It is said that the range of her voice is seven octaves. My favorite CD of hers is MTV unplugged. A variety of her songs is in it, and well-made.
  2. Sushi is one of Japanese traditional dishes, and very tasty. We, Japanese usually eat sushi for some occasions. Sushi is kind of expensive, but if you like raw fish, you'll love it. If you are not sure, just try it. There is one kind of sushi called Californian Roll which you can only taste in the States.
  3. I like Les Mis Erables in general. I read its book, watched its movie, and finally I saw its musical at the Broadway in N.Y. The musical was so great. One of the good things about it was its songs. They sang so well!!

Questions I can now answer
  1. What is URL?
  2. What is HTML?
  3. Where is the good place to find Japanese culture in Japan?
  4. How is the life in Indonesia different from us?
  5. How can you enjoy music, mystery, and biography all together?

  1. What is URL?

     URL is a Uniform Resource Locator where you can find the information on the Internet. URL includes a scheme which is the way to retrieve the information, a host where the information is located, and a path which leads you to the particular location of the information. The point is that you can get the information not only from a particular computer but also from any kind of computer on the network. It can also include queries which you will get the answers from it.

    Return to list of questions.

    • Uniform Resource Locators
    • BNF for specific URL schemes

  2. What is HTML?

     HTML is a Hyper Text Markup Language which defines the structure of the documents in order to make the documents readable on any computers. So you don't need to create a separate version of the documents, and it makes you easy to access the resources. However, to make the documents into HTML format, you have to follow certain rules. First of all, you have to use tags and entities to create HTML format. HTML format basically consists of HEAD and BODY elements.

    Return to list of questions.

    • An Instantaneous Introduction to HTML Forms
    • Composing Good HTML

  3. Where is the good place to find Japanese culture in Japan?

     There are many places where you can find Japanese culture in Japan. The most famous spot, however, is a city called Kyoto. Kyoto was a Japan's old capital from 794 till 1192. A lot of Japanese culture flourished in Kyoto during that era which is Heian Era. You can find more than 1600 Buddhist temples and 270 Shinto shurines which represent Japan's major religions. Kyoto is very beautiful in spring, fall, and winter, but you might want to avoid summer unles you can stand humidity in Kyoto.

    Return to list of questions.

  4. How is the life in Indonesia different from us?

     First of all, in Indonesia most of the people, especially women wear the clothes called sarong. This is a whole big piece of cloth which they just wrap around their waist. The majotiry of the people in Indonesia is Moslem, and when they go to temple, they usually wear Sarong, and they are not allowed to expose their skin. In some area they often use bike taxies as a means of transportation. Even though their life is influenced by Western culture gradually, they still keep their traditional culture in Indonesia.

    Return to list of questions.

  5. How can you enjoy music, mystery, and biography all together?

     The answer is Amadeus. This is a movie about a incredible composer, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. This movie is led by a flashback of Antonio Salieri who is jealous of a talent of Mozart. It is said that the death of Mozart is a kind of mystery, and has something to do with Salieri. Since this movie is all about Mozart, there is a lot of classical music included in it, and that is well-organized. Thus, you can enjoy his biography, a mystery, and music all together at one time.

    Return to list of questions.

Submitted January 30, 1995 for ICS 1C
